00033 #include "EulerIvpOdeSolver.hpp"
00034 #include "AbstractIvpOdeSolver.hpp"
00035 #include "AbstractOdeSystem.hpp"
00036 #include "OdeSolution.hpp"
00037 
00038 //#include <iostream>
00039 #include <vector>
00040 
00054 void EulerIvpOdeSolver::CalculateNextYValue(AbstractOdeSystem* pAbstractOdeSystem,
00055                                             double timeStep,
00056                                             double time,
00057                                             std::vector<double>& currentYValues,
00058                                             std::vector<double>& nextYValues)
00059 {
00060     // for each timestep in AbstractOneStepIvpSolver calculates a vector containing
00061     // the next Y value from the current one for each equation in the system.
00062 
00063     const unsigned num_equations = pAbstractOdeSystem->GetNumberOfStateVariables();
00064 
00065     // Yes, this looks weird, but it makes good use of memory!
00066     pAbstractOdeSystem->EvaluateYDerivatives(time, currentYValues, nextYValues);
00067 
00068     for (unsigned i=0;i<num_equations; i++)
00069     {
00070         // nextYValues contains dY/dt until here
00071         nextYValues[i] = currentYValues[i] + timeStep*nextYValues[i];
00072     }
00073 }
